page.title: 04All Saints Church
page.content: The tower of this Church is readily seen from the Village. It is a very plain tower which suggests that it is of Norman origin. The bells are interesting. The treble was given by George Notley and has an inscription on it "My treble voice makes hearts rejoice". Another bell was made about 1543. As you enter the Church via a fine large porch it can be seen that the Chancel arch is out of line. Tkhere are various theories to explain this.. The 13th Century roof is one of the best features of the Church. It is a waggon roof. There are many similar in West Somerset - but this is a particularly fine example. There are some excellent examples of woodcarving. The Jacobean screen and the bench ends and 16th Century being all very interesting.
